item.title: Using TCL to Update E164 Pattern Maps
item.author: robert.profit82@gmail.com (Robert Profit)
item.description: Using TCL for E164-Pattern-Map Modification Contents Using TCL for E164-Pattern-Map Modification Contents Introduction Prerequisites Components Used Create Initial Pattern-Map File and Load into Memory - Detailed Explanation File Creation Example with Data Append Data to an Existing File Example: Create the File and Remove a Single Line or Pattern Creating the file Removing a Single Line from the File Removing Entries Remove a Single Line from an Existing File Detailed Explanation Remove Multiple Single Entries Detailed Explanation Use RegEx to Match Multiple Numbers Match an Entry with Wild Cards Present Example: Removing Multiple Lines from a File Appendix Result of Not Reloading the Modified File Carriage Returns are Acceptable in a Pattern-Map Introduction This document provides a detailed overview of utilizing Tool Command Language (TCL) for the effective management of dynamic E164-pattern-maps stored locally on routers.
